message: Ok, let's start a discussion here about tools to read MCNP output / do other MCNP-related tasks. I have some preliminary stuff that reads srctp files (fairly complete if I'm not mistaken), mctal (not complete at all), and runtpe (not complete at all) that I can throw up on staging.

Paul Wilson wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> We have just been having conversations here about Python tools to read MCNP output:
>
>     * mctal
>     * meshtal
>     * outp - extracting lost particle histories
>
> We might consider adding these to pyne as well...  and spurring even further discussion of directory layout?

What about PTRAC? Anyone already tackled that one?  There is a lot of interest on the mailing list on this. It is also ripe for a collaborative project since any single contributor may only be interested in one aspect at a time.
Also, if anyone needs commit rights, please let me know.
@Scopatz - LANL's MCNP mailing list has regular (monthly?) requests for format specs of PTRAC

I personally have no experience with ptrac files so that is probably better left for someone else. Paul- does your group currently have any Python stuff for mctal or outp or has it just been discussion thus far? I put up what I have up on staging so you can take a look at that.

One thing that should probably be part of the "common infrastructure" is a class to read binary files (esp. Fortran records). I have this functionality in a few different places (although the credit should go to Nick who wrote this functionality for the cccc module).
@paul_romano Do we have a CCCC module in pyne somewhere?
We have a Perl script for parsing outp for lost particle info, some Matlab for parsing and operating on meshtal, and some new (today) python for mctal
Just looked at @paul_romano's mctal reader: it's all about keff - we're planning to add tallies
@gonuke We do have a CCCC module. Check out python/pyne/cccc.py on staging. It has classes for ISOTXS, SPECTR, and DLAYXS.
Great! I may look into extending CCCC for RTFLUX/ATFLUX
As @gonuke mentioned, we've made some progress on reading tallies out of mctal files.  @scopatz: I'm code-scribe on github.  What I have is imperfect but may be suitable for staging.
@code_scribe You are now added.  Happy Hacking!
